rationale: The documentation includes the patient's reported nausea as a side effect of lithium, noting the timing (morning) and improvement with food.
There is no mention of the patient's concern about long-term effects of lithium or the clinician's plan to monitor levels closely.
The documentation does not include any information about the patient's support system or the partner's role in medication adherence.
There is no mention of potential adjustments to lithium dosage or timing if nausea persists.
The clinician's advice to take lithium with food to mitigate nausea is documented.
There is no documentation of a follow-up plan or further assessment of the patient's bipolar disorder.
